# 9.0 Docs

- [Breaking change: Dev cert export no longer creates folder](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/aspnet-core/9.0/certificate-export.md): Learn about the breaking change in ASP.NET Core 9 where exporting the development certificate no longer creates the target directory if it doesn't exist.
- [Breaking change: HostBuilder enables ValidateOnBuild/ValidateScopes in development environment](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/aspnet-core/9.0/hostbuilder-validation.md): Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 where HostBuilder now enables ValidateOnBuild and ValidateScopes in the development environment.
- [Breaking change: DefaultKeyResolution.ShouldGenerateNewKey has altered meaning](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/aspnet-core/9.0/key-resolution.md): Learn about the breaking change in ASP.NET Core 9.0 where DefaultKeyResolution.ShouldGenerateNewKey has a slightly altered meaning.
- [Legacy Mono and Emscripten JavaScript APIs not exported to global namespace in Blazor WebAssembly apps](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/aspnet-core/9.0/legacy-apis.md): Learn about the breaking change in ASP.NET Core 9 where legacy Mono and Emscripten APIs are now accessible through the Blazor.runtime object instead of the global namespace.
- [Breaking change: Middleware types with multiple constructors](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/aspnet-core/9.0/middleware-constructors.md): Learn about the breaking change in ASP.NET Core 9 where having multiple constructors in a middleware type can cause an exception at runtime.
